text: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is an approach where an LLM looks up relevant documents from a knowledge base before generating an answer.
FAISS is a library developed by Meta AI for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors.
Embedding models like Sentence Transformers convert text into numerical vectors that can be compared for semantic similarity.
Chunking refers to splitting documents into smaller segments so retrieval works better over long text.
There are libraries for searching like Scikit-Learn's nearest neighbors and Annoy. These are not FAISS.
Some documents mention RAG but focus on retrieval speed, while others focus on generative coherence. This causes ambiguity.
A closely related approach to FAISS is HNSW, used for approximate nearest neighbors.
